text: Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again.

It is the near future, and humanity struggle to stay alive on a seemingly bare planet. Humans once wielded formidable magical power, powered by an energy source that was once abudant on the planet called mana. However, over time, when humanity reached a population of 7 billion, Mana began to deplete, seemingly becoming spread too thinly for it to have an effect. This prove troublesome when alien forces attacked the planet one fateful day.

Humanity was powerless to stand against the hostile alien forces, who wielded superior technology not reliant on Mana. When the alien forces reduced humanity to a mere fraction, the remaining survivors discover that a means to reawaken Mana to its past potential. Stumbling onto an ancient temple, one that predates the majority of modern civilizations, the survivors learned of a way to rejuvenate the Mana of the planet, making it so humans could once again wield magic.

Humans once wielded formidable magical power, powered by an energy source that was once abudant on the planet called mana. However, over time, when humanity reached a population of 7 billion, Mana began to deplete, seemingly becoming spread too thinly for it to have an effect. This prove troublesome when alien forces attacked the planet one fateful day.

Humanity was powerless to stand against the hostile alien forces, who wielded superior technology not reliant on Mana. When the alien forces reduced humanity to a mere fraction, the remaining survivors discover that a means to reawaken Mana to its past potential. Stumbling onto an ancient temple, one that predates the majority of modern civilizations, the survivors learned of a way to rejuvenate the Mana of the planet, making it so humans could once again wield magic. 

However, not all were in agreement.

It is the near future, and humanity struggle to stay alive on a seemingly bare planet. Humans once wielded formidable magical power, powered by an energy source that was once abudant on the planet called mana. However, over time, when humanity reached a population of 7 billion, Mana began to deplete, seemingly becoming spread too thinly for it to have an effect. This prove troublesome when alien forces attacked the planet one fateful day.

Humanity was powerless to stand against the hostile alien forces, who wielded superior technology not reliant on Mana. When the alien forces reduced humanity to a mere fraction, the remaining survivors discover that a means to reawaken Mana to its past potential. Stumbling onto an ancient temple, one that predates the majority of modern civilizations, the survivors learned of a way to rejuvenate the Mana of the planet, making it so humans could once again wield magic. 

However, not all were in agreement. For the cost of doing so, means that many would have to be sacrificed, their souls powering an ancient machine to create new sources of Mana. For that was the true source of past Mana, ancient humans that were killed by ancient civilizations who deemed their sacrifice critical for the survival of mankind.

It is the near future, and humanity struggle to stay alive on a seemingly bare planet. Humans once wielded formidable magical power, powered by an energy source that was once abudant on the planet called mana. However, over time, when humanity reached a population of 7 billion, Mana began to deplete, seemingly becoming spread too thinly for it to have an effect. This prove troublesome when alien forces attacked the planet one fateful day.

Humanity was powerless to stand against the hostile alien forces, who wielded superior technology not reliant on Mana. When the alien forces reduced humanity to a mere fraction, the remaining survivors discover that a means to reawaken Mana to its past potential. Stumbling onto an ancient temple, one that predates the majority of modern civilizations, the survivors learned of a way to rejuvenate the Mana of the planet, making it so humans could once again wield magic. 

However, not all were in agreement. For the cost of doing so, means that many would have to be sacrificed, their souls powering an ancient machine to create new sources of Mana. For that was the true source of past Mana, ancient humans that were killed by ancient civilizations who deemed their sacrifice critical for the survival of mankind. 

The survivors argued, debating the ethics of the practice. Failure to make such a sacrifice would surely entail that the aliens would win, who would not only take over the planet for its natural resources, but also kill off the remaining humans. The sacrifice was argued by many to be too great, given how little people remained on the planet.

In the end, many volunteered, giving their lives to make the sacrifice to save the rest of humanity.

It is the near future, and humanity struggle to stay alive on a seemingly bare planet. Humans once wielded formidable magical power, powered by an energy source that was once abudant on the planet called mana. However, over time, when humanity reached a population of 7 billion, Mana began to deplete, seemingly becoming spread too thinly for it to have an effect. This prove troublesome when alien forces attacked the planet one fateful day.

Humanity was powerless to stand against the hostile alien forces, who wielded superior technology not reliant on Mana. When the alien forces reduced humanity to a mere fraction, the remaining survivors discover that a means to reawaken Mana to its past potential. Stumbling onto an ancient temple, one that predates the majority of modern civilizations, the survivors learned of a way to rejuvenate the Mana of the planet, making it so humans could once again wield magic. 

However, not all were in agreement. For the cost of doing so, means that many would have to be sacrificed, their souls powering an ancient machine to create new sources of Mana. For that was the true source of past Mana, ancient humans that were killed by ancient civilizations who deemed their sacrifice critical for the survival of mankind. 

The survivors argued, debating the ethics of the practice. Failure to make such a sacrifice would surely entail that the aliens would win, who would not only take over the planet for its natural resources, but also kill off the remaining humans. The sacrifice was argued by many to be too great, given how little people remained on the planet. 

In the end, many volunteered, giving their lives to make the sacrifice to save the rest of humanity. With the sacrifice completed, the energy from it restored Mana to its full potential. The remaining humans were able to wield magic once again, and defeated the aliens with ease. Unfortunately, in the end the created Mana was depleted once again, and the survivors found themselves powerless once again. Many were filled with guilt from the sacrifice made by those who volunteered to create Mana to stop the aliens, others with fear that the ancient machine may be abused by future generations. So the survivors agreed to seal the location of the ancient machine, and remove all traces of existence.

Humans once wielded formidable magical power, powered by an energy source that was once abudant on the planet called mana. However, over time, when humanity reached a population of 7 billion, Mana began to deplete, seemingly becoming spread too thinly for it to have an effect. The survivors argued, debating the ethics of the practice. Failure to make such a sacrifice would surely entail that the aliens would win, who would not only take over the planet for its natural resources, but also kill off the remaining humans. The sacrifice was argued by many to be too great, given how little people remained on the planet. 

In the end, many volunteered, giving their lives to make the sacrifice to save the rest of humanity. With the sacrifice completed, the energy from it restored Mana to its full potential. The remaining humans were able to wield magic once again, and defeated the aliens with ease. Unfortunately, in the end the created Mana was depleted once again, and the survivors found themselves powerless once again. Many were filled with guilt from the sacrifice made by those who volunteered to create Mana to stop the aliens, others with fear that the ancient machine may be abused by future generations. So the survivors agreed to seal the location of the ancient machine, and remove all traces of existence. 

Now, a hundred years later, humanity has recovered.

It is the near future, and humanity struggle to stay alive on a seemingly bare planet. Humans once wielded formidable magical power, powered by an energy source that was once abudant on the planet called mana. However, over time, when humanity reached a population of 7 billion, Mana began to deplete, seemingly becoming spread too thinly for it to have an effect. This prove troublesome when alien forces attacked the planet one fateful day.

Humanity was powerless to stand against the hostile alien forces, who wielded superior technology not reliant on Mana. When the alien forces reduced humanity to a mere fraction, the remaining survivors discover that a means to reawaken Mana to its past potential. Stumbling onto an ancient temple, one that predates the majority of modern civilizations, the survivors learned of a way to rejuvenate the Mana of the planet, making it so humans could once again wield magic. 

However, not all were in agreement. For the cost of doing so, means that many would have to be sacrificed, their souls powering an ancient machine to create new sources of Mana. For that was the true source of past Mana, ancient humans that were killed by ancient civilizations who deemed their sacrifice critical for the survival of mankind. 

The survivors argued, debating the ethics of the practice. Failure to make such a sacrifice would surely entail that the aliens would win, who would not only take over the planet for its natural resources, but also kill off the remaining humans. The sacrifice was argued by many to be too great, given how little people remained on the planet. 

In the end, many volunteered, giving their lives to make the sacrifice to save the rest of humanity. With the sacrifice completed, the energy from it restored Mana to its full potential. The remaining humans were able to wield magic once again, and defeated the aliens with ease. Unfortunately, in the end the created Mana was depleted once again, and the survivors found themselves powerless once again. Many were filled with guilt from the sacrifice made by those who volunteered to create Mana to stop the aliens, others with fear that the ancient machine may be abused by future generations. So the survivors agreed to seal the location of the ancient machine, and remove all traces of Mana from literature and existence. 

Now, a hundred years later, humanity has recovered. Instead of Mana, humanity focused on technology instead, given that they no longer wielded the magic that was once available in the past. Most were unaware that humanity wielded magic, nor had any idea that Mana existed at one point in time.

It is the near future, and humanity struggle to stay alive on a seemingly bare planet. Humans once wielded formidable magical power, powered by an energy source that was once abudant on the planet called mana. However, over time, when humanity reached a population of 7 billion, Mana began to deplete, seemingly becoming spread too thinly for it to have an effect. This prove troublesome when alien forces attacked the planet one fateful day.

Humanity was powerless to stand against the hostile alien forces, who wielded superior technology not reliant on Mana. When the alien forces reduced humanity to a mere fraction, the remaining survivors discover that a means to reawaken Mana to its past potential. Stumbling onto an ancient temple, one that predates the majority of modern civilizations, the survivors learned of a way to rejuvenate the Mana of the planet, making it so humans could once again wield magic. 

However, not all were in agreement. For the cost of doing so, means that many would have to be sacrificed, their souls powering an ancient machine to create new sources of Mana. For that was the true source of past Mana, ancient humans that were killed by ancient civilizations who deemed their sacrifice critical for the survival of mankind. 

The survivors argued, debating the ethics of the practice. Failure to make such a sacrifice would surely entail that the aliens would win, who would not only take over the planet for its natural resources, but also kill off the remaining humans. The sacrifice was argued by many to be too great, given how little people remained on the planet. 

In the end, many volunteered, giving their lives to make the sacrifice to save the rest of humanity. With the sacrifice completed, the energy from it restored Mana to its full potential. The remaining humans were able to wield magic once again, and defeated the aliens with ease. Unfortunately, in the end the created Mana was depleted once again, and the survivors found themselves powerless once again. Many were filled with guilt from the sacrifice made by those who volunteered to create Mana to stop the aliens, others with fear that the ancient machine may be abused by future generations. So the survivors agreed to seal the location of the ancient machine, and remove all traces of Mana from literature and existence. 

Now, a hundred years later, humanity has recovered. Instead of Mana, humanity focused on technology instead, given that they no longer wielded the magic that was once available in the past. Most were unaware that humanity wielded magic, nor had any idea that Mana existed at one point in time. 

100 years later from the outcome of the alien attack, a group of researches come across the site of the ancient machine. They discover several texts detailing the existence of magic, of Mana and its creation. What the fate of the ancient machine then was unknown, for the researchers never disclose their findings. Mana would never exist in the world ever again, a relic of the past that was too dangerous for the world to discover once again.
